oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Watching the sternwheel steamboat pass
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An African American man sits with two boys perched atop tree roots. The setting is beside a wide river. All three folks wear caps, and they look toward the river. The stern wheel of a steamboat can be seen at left.

"Roustabouts" was the name given to the men who handled freight on the commercial steamboats that plied Southern rivers after the Civil War. Many worked at the river landings where the boats made stops.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Boys; Rivers; Children; Stern wheelers; Steamboats
